byline.contributor: Stephanie Saul reported from Faridabad, India, and Louise Story from New York. Sai Manish contributed reporting from Faridabad.
byline.original: By STEPHANIE SAUL and LOUISE STORY

abstract: New York Times investigation directly links New Delhi developer Kabul Chawla to condo in Time Warner Center's south tower; finds also that condo is one of nearly two-thirds of 192 condos in building that are owned through shell companies; NYC Real Estate Opportunities, Delaware company with Singapore address, bought condo for Chawla in 2012, even as protests swirled in India that his company BPTP failed to deliver on presold units (Series: Towers of Secrecy).
lead_paragraph: As reports of unfinished homes mounted against Kabul Chawla, a New Delhi builder, an opaque corporate entity bought a $19 million condo at the Time Warner Center.

headline.main: Amid Complaints in India, a Real Estate Deal in Manhattan
headline.print_headline: Amid Complaints in India, a Condo Deal in Manhattan

snippet: As reports of unfinished homes mounted against Kabul Chawla, a New Delhi builder, an opaque corporate entity bought a $19 million condo at the Time Warner Center.
